meanings.definition: Dengues (noun): a tropical disease caused by a virus transmitted by mosquitoes
meanings.sent1: Many people in tropical regions suffer from dengues every year.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed him with dengues after his trip to a mosquito-infested area.
meanings.sent3: Despite its name, dengues is definitely not a fun souvenir from a vacation.
meanings.sent4: The spread of dengues in the community was like a silent invasion by tiny, buzzing enemies.
meanings.sent5: The fear of dengues lingered in the air like a humid fog.

meanings.definition: Dengues (verb): to suffer from or be infected with dengue fever
meanings.sent1: She dengues for weeks after returning from her trip.
meanings.sent2: He dengues every time he visits a tropical country.
meanings.sent3: The mosquitoes seem to always pick on him to dengues.
meanings.sent4: The thought of having to dengues again made her shudder.
meanings.sent5: Dengues can really put a damper on your travel plans.

meanings.definition: Dengues (adjective): relating to or characteristic of dengue fever
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the dengues symptoms to the worried patient.
meanings.sent2: She wore long sleeves to protect herself from dengues mosquitoes.
meanings.sent3: The dengues prevention campaign aimed to educate the community.
meanings.sent4: The dengues outbreak was a wake-up call for better mosquito control.
meanings.sent5: His dengues history made him more cautious during mosquito season.
